description: From Middle English ruynous, from Old French ruinos, ruineus, from Latin ruīnōsus; surface analysis ruin +‎ -ous.

adjectives.description: ruinous (comparative more ruinous, superlative most ruinous)

entries.meaning: Extremely costly; so expensive as to cause financial ruin.
examples: They were forced to completely replace the roof at ruinous expense.

entries.meaning: Characterized by ruin; ruined; dilapidated; as, an edifice, bridge, or wall in a ruinous state.
